## Part one

1.  Let's upload the database in the memory of our computer.

```{r}
PATH <- 'C:\\Users\\adadi\\OneDrive\\Desktop\\Advanced_statistics\\Data_CitiBike\\JC-'

LASTNAME <- '-citibike-tripdata.csv'
counter <- 201902

num_databases = 4
databases <- character(num_databases)
data <- character(num_databases)
for (i in 1:num_databases) {
  data[i] <- sprintf("%s%i%s", PATH, counter, LASTNAME)
  databases[i] <- read.csv(data[i])
  counter <- counter+ 1 
}
summary(databases[2])
head(databases[2])

```

2)  Now we want to merge the five data frames in a unique structure

```{r}

for (i in 2:num_databases) {
     df <- rbind(databases[1], databases[i])
}
summary(df)
```

3) Check for missing data and remove it, if any 

```{r}
missing_data <- is.na(df) #cerco righe nulle nel dataframe
complete_rows <- complete.cases(df) #cerco elementi non nulli nel df
df <- df[complete_rows ]
```
